content: My link for this was on the local News here in NC today at 6pm WITN news and the Logan Airport local news. I wonder what was going through this young Marines mind when he decided to do this? I also wonder why he is only being held on a $50,000 bail bond? U.S. Marine arrested at Logan Airport for weapons possession Mia Carter Boston (WBZ Newsroom) -- Massachusetts State Police have arrested a U.S. Marine at Boston's Logan Airport, after he was allegedly found with weapons and explosives in his luggage. Police say it was approximately 7:10 a.m. Sunday, April 19, when an explosive detection luggage screening machine was activated by a piece of luggage, said to belong to 22-year-old Justin Reed, a U.S. Marine stationed at Camp Lejeune, in Jacksonville, North Carolina. It's being reported that Reed had arrived at Logan Airport from Las Vegas aboard a red-eye flight; he was reportedly scheduled to board an 8:00 a.m. flight to Charlotte, North Carolina. He apparently had to re-check his luggage during the layover. Reed was tracked down by authorities and taken into custody without incident. He faces charges that include unlawful possession of an infernal machine and unlawful possession of a concealed weapon in a secure area of an airport Reed was ordered held on $50,000 bail. He is scheduled to appear in East Boston District Court Tuesday.
reply: My link for this was on the local News here in NC today at 6pm WITN news and the Logan Airport local news. I wonder what was going through this young Marines mind when he decided to do this? I also wonder why he is only being held on a $50,000 bail bond? TSA screeners in Terminal B called State Police at 7:10 a.m. after a screen discovered the following items in his checked baggage: a locked handgun box containing a semi-automatic handgun, a fully loaded gun magazine, several boxes of 9 mm and 7.62 mm ammunition, three model rocket engines containing an explosive mixture, military pull-type fuses, switches, electronics kit boxes with various components, and a hand grenade fuse assembly with detonator. content: "http://www.miamiherald.com/news/florida/AP/story/1007751.html" Reported here by the AP Wires. Here is a Comment (name withheld) ""Associated Press does it again. Erroneous reporting. It is not illegal to have a declared unloaded firearm in one's CHECKED baggage. And one is allowed 11 lbs of properly packages amminution in checked baggage. Las Vegas/McCarran probably knew it and if properly declared, allowed the bag to pass. Bomb-making materials, yes a serious issue. Once the bag is taken through TSA, the bag is in a 'secured area'. Something is missing in the explanation of charges. Meanwhile, this is another attempt at fearmongering to 'demonize' firearms and in a sensationalist manner to gain readership and garner ad revenues."" A Comment from an AP Subscriber. My point is that DHS "set" this up somehow, someway. Two reasons being (to get our Guns) and to (add fuel to the fire about "returning Vets being 'dangerous' Rightwingers'). I have no idea if the above quote is correct. I hope it's true. At any rate, the US Marine is in jail. I think it's a "mstake". i just don't see a Marine doing this. I really don't. AS above..just souveniers (sp) or something.

content: My link for this was on the local News here in NC today at 6pm WITN news and the Logan Airport local news. I wonder what was going through this young Marines mind when he decided to do this? I also wonder why he is only being held on a $50,000 bail bond? U.S. Marine arrested at Logan Airport for weapons possession Mia Carter Boston (WBZ Newsroom) -- Massachusetts State Police have arrested a U.S. Marine at Boston's Logan Airport, after he was allegedly found with weapons and explosives in his luggage. Police say it was approximately 7:10 a.m. Sunday, April 19, when an explosive detection luggage screening machine was activated by a piece of luggage, said to belong to 22-year-old Justin Reed, a U.S. Marine stationed at Camp Lejeune, in Jacksonville, North Carolina. It's being reported that Reed had arrived at Logan Airport from Las Vegas aboard a red-eye flight; he was reportedly scheduled to board an 8:00 a.m. flight to Charlotte, North Carolina. He apparently had to re-check his luggage during the layover. Reed was tracked down by authorities and taken into custody without incident. He faces charges that include unlawful possession of an infernal machine and unlawful possession of a concealed weapon in a secure area of an airport Reed was ordered held on $50,000 bail. He is scheduled to appear in East Boston District Court Tuesday.
reply: My link for this was on the local News here in NC today at 6pm WITN news and the Logan Airport local news. I wonder what was going through this young Marines mind when he decided to do this? I also wonder why he is only being held on a $50,000 bail bond? content: quote: Originally posted by Agent991: "http://www.miamiherald.com/news/florida/AP/story/1007751.html" Reported here by the AP Wires. Here is a Comment (name withheld) ""Associated Press does it again. Erroneous reporting. It is not illegal to have a declared unloaded firearm in one's CHECKED baggage. And one is allowed 11 lbs of properly packages amminution in checked baggage. Las Vegas/McCarran probably knew it and if properly declared, allowed the bag to pass. Bomb-making materials, yes a serious issue. Once the bag is taken through TSA, the bag is in a 'secured area'. Something is missing in the explanation of charges. Meanwhile, this is another attempt at fearmongering to 'demonize' firearms and in a sensationalist manner to gain readership and garner ad revenues."" A Comment from an AP Subscriber. My point is that DHS "set" this up somehow, someway. Two reasons being (to get our Guns) and to (add fuel to the fire about "returning Vets being 'dangerous' Rightwingers'). I have no idea if the above quote is correct. I hope it's true. At any rate, the US Marine is in jail. I think it's a "mstake". i just don't see a Marine doing this. I really don't. AS above..just souveniers (sp) or something. "a hand grenade fuse assembly with detonator" is NOT a souvenier! Unless these items were planted by TSA...this guy's got issues. I for one have no problem with a pistol and ammo...if the weapon was declared and unloaded, I do have a problem with some of the other items!

content: quote: Originally posted by outlaws93: quote: Originally posted by OddBall1st: The toy rocket engines are Ram Jet fuel, confined will explode !! Prolly wanted to fill that Grande with it !! I`ve put them on the nosecone of the toys,..instean of a shute,...you get a LOUD report !! yea man something nifty for a souvenir... i am dishearted that so many of you would jump on the he is a terrorist bandwagon an active duty Marine... Are you telling me that being a member of the military automatically disqualifies a person as a potential wacko? 20 years in tells me you could be incorrect. after all he came in from las vegas and didnt blow that up or even put the pieces together to blow up the next flight... but yet some will think he had foul intentions.... Transporting unauthorized explosives on a commerical aircraft is at best extremely poor judgement and at worsed criminal...probably both...the boy has some splain'in to do.
